result.execSummary:
The defendant James Willie Garner Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Willie Garner Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Willie Garner in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

-Court ordered the defendant to pay courst costs and victim/witness surcharges by 3/2/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 3/2/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant James Willie Garner in court with attorney Michael Bishop for attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Final Pretrial held. Case remains on the calendar for Jury Trial on 3/2/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15.

Defendant James Willie Garner in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot and attorney David Ziemer.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Matter in Court on defense Motion to Suppress.
Sworn for the State: Detective Gust Petropoulos. State rests. Defense rests. After hearing testimony and argument from both parties, Court denies defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 2/20/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 3/2/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed.

Attorney David Knute Ziemer in court, defendant James Willie Garner not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter adjourned.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed.

Attorney Vincent J. Bobot in court, defendant James Willie Garner not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty requests a search/seizure motion.  Defense motion due 12-12-14.  State reply due 1-5-15.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Willie Garner in court with attorney Michael F. Bishop.  Defendant James Willie Garner in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael F. Bishop in court, defendant James Willie Garner not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is in Federal custody in Kentucky. Court is satisfied that the defendant was in custody at the time of the missed court appearance. Court withdraws warrant. Case calendared for PRELIMINARY HEARING on 11/25/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch PE.

Attorney Michael F. Bishop in court, defendant James Willie Garner not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is currently in custody in Kentucky. Court needs to hear from the defendant regarding retaining Atty. Bishop. Case calendared for STATUS on 11/10/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
to Vacate or Stay Warrant for Non-Appearance and to Reinstate Bail, received and filed. sab
No reply from surety or defendant.
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed./ds
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file.  ($500.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court.  Paul Hauer on behalf of William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  eam
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail forfeited.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 4/14/14.

14RM018887  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-05-2014
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant James Willie Garner in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant James Willie Garner in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
